They work in diverse industries including technology companies, healthcare, finance, and government agencies, collaborating with teams to deliver functional software solutions.

title: Solutions Architects
description:
Solutions Architects design comprehensive technical solutions that address complex business challenges. They work at the intersection of technology and business, translating requirements into system architectures, evaluating technologies, and guiding implementation teams to ensure successful delivery.

These professionals work at technology vendors (AWS, Microsoft, Google), consulting firms, and enterprises. They often support sales teams by demonstrating technical feasibility, designing proof-of-concepts, and building trust with technical stakeholders. The work involves significant client interaction, presentations, and staying current with rapidly evolving technology landscapes.

Solutions Architecture offers excellent compensation, variety in projects, and the opportunity to influence major technology decisions. The role requires both deep technical expertise and strong communication skills. Career paths lead to principal architect roles, CTO positions, or senior consulting roles. Cloud vendor certifications (AWS SA, Azure Solutions Architect) are highly valued.

title: Speech-Language Pathologists
description: Assess, diagnose, treat, and help prevent communication and swallowing disorders in patients.

title: Supervisors, Protective Services
description: These professionals oversee and coordinate the daily operations of protective service personnel across various settings including correctional facilities, police departments, fire stations, and security operations. They manage work schedules, ensure compliance with policies and regulations, and maintain safety and security within their assigned areas. Supervisors in this field provide guidance to front-line workers while handling administrative duties and emergency response coordination.

title: Surgeons
description: Surgeons are highly trained medical professionals who diagnose conditions and perform operative procedures to treat diseases, injuries, and disorders affecting various parts of the human body. These specialists work in hospitals, surgical centers, and medical clinics, focusing on areas such as the eyes, musculoskeletal system, or pediatric conditions. They provide comprehensive patient care from initial examination through post-operative recovery.

title: Surgical Technologists
description: Assist in surgical operations by preparing operating rooms, arranging equipment, and helping doctors during surgeries.

title: Systems Administrators
description: Install, configure, and maintain an organization's local area networks, wide area networks, and internet systems.

title: Textile Workers
description: Textile workers operate machinery and use hand tools to create, process, repair, and finish various fabric, leather, and synthetic materials across manufacturing facilities, dry cleaning establishments, and specialized shops. These professionals work with sewing machines, pressing equipment, dyeing apparatus, and cutting tools to produce garments, upholstery, footwear, and other textile products. Their responsibilities range from machine operation and quality monitoring to custom design work and detailed hand finishing.

title: Transportation Supervisors
description: Transportation Supervisors oversee and coordinate the activities of workers involved in moving people, materials, and cargo across various transportation sectors including aviation, recycling operations, and passenger services. These professionals ensure safety compliance, train employees on proper procedures, and manage the efficient loading, unloading, and handling of materials or passengers. They work in airports, recycling facilities, transportation hubs, and other logistics environments where they monitor work quality and maintain operational standards.

title: Transportation Workers
description: Transportation workers specialize in the safe and efficient movement of materials and goods across various modes of transport. These professionals load and unload chemicals, bulk solids, and other materials into tank cars, trucks, ships, and barges while operating pumps, valves, and material moving equipment. They work in shipping facilities, rail yards, ports, and industrial sites, ensuring accurate placement and secure transport of cargo.

title: UX/Product Designers
description:
UX/Product Designers create user-centered digital experiences by researching user needs, designing interfaces, and validating solutions. They own the end-to-end design process from problem definition to final implementation, ensuring products are intuitive, accessible, and delightful to use.

These professionals work primarily in technology but UX roles exist across e-commerce, finance, healthcare, and any industry with digital products. They collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and researchers in iterative design processes. Modern product design combines traditional UX skills with visual design, prototyping, and systems thinking.

UX/Product Design offers strong compensation, creative fulfillment, and direct impact on how millions of people interact with technology. Portfolios demonstrating user-centered thinking and business impact are essential for advancement. Career paths lead to senior/staff design roles, design management, or specialization in research, systems, or accessibility.

title: Vehicle & Mobile Equipment Mechanics
description: Vehicle and mobile equipment mechanics diagnose, repair, and maintain a wide range of motorized vehicles and machinery, from cars and trucks to aircraft, boats, and heavy construction equipment. These skilled professionals work in dealerships, repair shops, airports, marinas, and industrial facilities, using specialized tools and technical manuals to ensure vehicles operate safely and efficiently.

title: Veterinarians
description: Diagnose, treat, and research medical conditions and diseases of animals. May work with small animals, large animals, or in research settings.

title: Veterinary Technicians & Assistants
description: Veterinary technicians and assistants provide essential medical support in animal hospitals, clinics, and laboratories by performing diagnostic tests, administering medications, and caring for animals during treatment and recovery. These professionals assist veterinarians with medical procedures, monitor animals under anesthesia, maintain medical records, and ensure clean, safe environments for animal care. They work directly with pets and laboratory animals, combining hands-on animal care with technical medical skills.

title: Water Transportation Workers
description: Water transportation workers operate and maintain various types of vessels on rivers, lakes, coastal waters, and oceans. These professionals range from sailors and marine oilers who perform deck operations and equipment maintenance, to captains and pilots who command vessels, to engineers who oversee mechanical systems. They handle cargo operations, navigate waterways, ensure vessel safety, and may require specialized licenses depending on their role.

title: Web Developers & Designers
description: Web developers and designers create digital experiences by building websites, applications, and interactive interfaces that users engage with across various platforms and devices. These professionals write code, design user-friendly layouts, and develop engaging content ranging from business websites to immersive video games. They work for technology companies, design agencies, gaming studios, or as independent freelancers, combining technical skills with creative problem-solving.

title: Weighers, Measurers, Checkers, and Samplers, Recordkeeping
description: Weigh, measure, and check materials, supplies, and equipment for the purpose of keeping relevant records. Duties are primarily clerical by nature. Includes workers who collect and keep record of samples of products or materials.

title: Woodworkers
description: Woodworkers craft, shape, and finish wooden products using both hand tools and advanced machinery, including computer-controlled equipment. These skilled professionals create everything from custom furniture and cabinets to precision models and industrial patterns, working in manufacturing facilities, custom shops, or specialty workshops. They follow detailed blueprints and specifications to ensure quality and precision in their finished products.
